item.title: 2023 üîó
item.description: 29/01/2023 African Safaris - Trophy Hunting helps in animal conservation Weapon - Rods of God Weapon Idea Orbit Earth - Pointed cyclinder to drop on a particular location No TNT/Nuclear, Use Kinetic energy to cause damage Use Tungsten metal for its high density and high melting point Has many flaws for using this, so it was never implemented Cycle Agarbatti Business Case Study Solved two problems - fragrance and continuous burning Launched in 1948 in Mysore Interesting ‘Initial Sales’ - Lighted up agarbatti outside stores, the customers were attracted towards the fragrance and wanted to purchase 2nd generation came up with the idea of 3in1 agarbatti because people got bored out of same fragrance and therefore sales were irregular Advice for young by Jordan Peterson Find something to serve: Take on some responsibility, do something for other people Strive for competency: Everyone, who’s competent, is desperate for competent people Something that bugs your: Start with small, fix your bed, what bugs you in your room?

item.title: URI The Surgical Strike - my thoughts | wilspi
Avatar 2 - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: Beautiful visuals, screenplay, imax 3d was a treat Average story I went for the imax experience, but as a true indian I did feel that I didn’t get the full returns of the high pre-booking cost of the movie. I knew it was a risk but still I went for it as I did miss the theatre experience of the first part, and I didn’t want to miss this one.

item.title: Black Panther - Wakanda Forever - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: Thoughts Good Marvel movie after a while. Feminism: Good mix of Feminism which was not overly done. The women in the movie are never considered below or seem to be targeting men, a real equality. Black: The movie is just Black people, even the student scientist was black too. It is just like an Origin story

item.title: Plan A Plan B - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: Timepass movie, feel good movie if you dont think much. You know whats going to happen next, the risky turns are all evaded by changing the character traits

item.title: Kantara - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: Thoughts What a brilliant movie, such amalgamation of culture, story, socio-political issues. All kudos to writing and screenplay. The basic story is very common trope, connecting it to the culture (which is new to everyone) was the key. The story didn;t go overboard with the mythology part, it was all believable and realistic. Fantastically told story. The demigod connecting the bridges between man (protagonist) and the nature (forest officer). The story didn’t have much of twists and turns, but still kept me hooked.

item.title: Top Gun Maverick - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: I recently watched Top Gun and was not sure if this movie can offer anything more (with Tom Cruise in lead), probably more training and fighting jet sequences. Oh boy I was in for a ride. This was a new chapter with the same characters, and the writers connected it all so well. It was a continuation. After 30min, audience knew where the story would go, but the pace of the movie kept changing, the twists were good.

item.title: How to deal with introversion
item.description: Introversion Introversion is a personality trait characterized by a preference for solitude and a decreased need for social stimulation. While there is nothing inherently wrong with being introverted, it can sometimes pose challenges in certain situations, such as networking events, job interviews, or social gatherings. Introversion is a spectrum Introvert - Extrovert is a spectrum. Nobody is pure extrovert or introvert, we all fall somewhere in between. Labeling ourselves with one way or the other is counterproductive as we are very good in pattern matching and we see what we want to see.

item.title: 'A Marriage Knot' By Shobana Mahadevan - Book Notes
item.description: Thoughts Feel good book Classic love story, uses common tropes aunt is bad, uncle is good but helpless, mother-in-law is good and supportive the female lead gets saved by a prince (in terms of both qualities and riches) and she is looking for basic respect and freedom - classic damsel in distress the male lead gets pushed by the female lead and he acknowledges his responsibilities and finds his strength, he gets challenged by the female’s thought process and in turn keeps falling for her both complete each other, opposites attract (if both complement each other), which is the case here No strong conflict: Both (female and male leads) lack any negative trait, the resolution of their conflict is merely a conversation away - what they agreed upon and what they want now Captures Look dear.

item.title: Everything Everywhere All At Once - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: The screenplay, the visuals, the merging of different universes was brilliantly done. The characterisation was good. The crux of the story is simple and straightforward, Need to rewatch to understand the philosophical pov.

item.title: Monica Oh My Darling - my thoughts | wilspi
item.description: Thoughts Fun thriller, elements same as Andhadhun Timepass

item.title: 'Games People Play' By Eric Berne - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã First published in the 1960s and recognized as a classic work of its kind by professionals, the bestselling ‘Games People Play’ is also an accessible and fascinating read. It is a wise, original, witty and very sensible analysis of the games we play in order to live with one another and with ourselves. Captures Chapter 1 the most favoured forms of stimuli are those provided by physical intimacy In technical language, an ego state may be described phenomenologically as a coherent system of feelings, and operationally as a set of coherent behaviour patterns.

item.title: 'Acko on AIR - Subrata Mitra, Abhinav Chaturvedi (Accel Partners)' with Varun
item.description: ‚Äã Talk: Acko on AIR - Subrata, Abhinav (Accel Partners, Acko’s first investors) - at Acko townhall Notes: Anecdote by Abhinav - Sachin Bansal (his then colleague at Amazon) fixed code in amazon payment for which the team was struggling (system was crashing completely when running a test suite cos of which they were unable to launch) Flipkart initial investment by Subrata - 3.5 cr for 25% - everytime they would come they talk about something they fixed (everyday) - committed to the cause When looking for investment - references from networks matter (Accel will ask Varun for Acko’s employee) Why most startups fail get to some scale as quickly as possible (zero to one) not having sharp focus (anti of why win - having a sharp focus) team dynamics don’t workout, going out in different directions Advice to youngsters Abhinav, Subrata - work with really good people, it compounds (good mentor) Subrata - really enjoy working whatever you do Varun - stay with a team for long time (5yrs or so it takes to crack a market) - everything compounds - your skills, your market value, your networks (you don’t restart everytime) One trait which Abhinav looks for in early founders - mentally and physically fit - it is tough to maintain Acko vision - 10Bn dollar (by 2030), in market that compounds Make companies in bust (startup bubble, less distractions), they will come out on top (strong) when the market is out of bust, market cycle again starts (happened multiple times in past - 9/11, 2008 etc)

item.title: 'Masters of Scale - Eric Schmidt' with Reid Hoffman
item.description: ‚Äã Eric Schmidt was Executive Chairman of Google‚Äôs parent company, Alphabet, Inc. From 2001 to 2011 he was CEO of Google. Previously, he was CEO of Novell and before that a long-time executive at Sun Microsystems. Notes: HOFFMAN: Amit eventually built a tool that accurately predicts how much revenue the company had at any given time, down to the second. Pranks and productivity tend to blend together at Google, which is why Eric doesn‚Äôt dwell on the question of why Amit moved in to begin with.

item.title: 'The Ego and The Id' By Sigmund Freud - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã “The Ego and the Id” (1923) is a prominent paper (also book) by Sigmund Freud, the founder of psychoanalysis. The book formulates the structural personality model in which he articulates a map of the different layers which comprise the human soul: the conscious, unconscious and preconscious which correlate with the faculties of ego, id and super-ego. ‚Äã Captures Chapter 1: Consciousness and What is Unconscious ‚ÄòBeing conscious‚Äô is in the first place a purely descriptive term, resting on perception of the most immediate and certain character.

item.title: 'The Liberation of Sita' By Volga - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã Thoughts Does Ramayana qualify for a feminist fiction? Post Ram and Sita’s homecoming, Sita was asked to give a chastity test, and she left the palace after proving herself. She could have left without undergoing the test but then the public would have indeed believed that she was at fault. Whether Ramayana is based on true events or if it’s a fictional tale it doesn’t matter, in either case Sita’s character is liberating.

item.title: 2022 üîó
item.description: 29/12/2022 Computer Scientist explains Zero Knowledge Proof to 5 different aged people https://youtu.be/D1X5wi9NK9o?t=136 Why outlaws and villains (not necessary evils) have a larger fan following than the good-doers? Hero (or a good-doer) is often confused with the problem of “to be or not to be”, while the villain does what he thinks, so the fan-following is tilted more towards the villain because confidence attracts. If the hero is not stuck in the “to be or not to be” zone and is clear and confident and acts on things and his beliefs quickly, he shall gets all the attraction.

item.title: Seven Deadly Sins
item.description: ‚Äã The way we behave is mostly influenced by our surroundings (by law of averages you shall become average of folks you spend time with, over a long period of time) until and unless we mindfully start tweaking these behaviours. Here, as the title suggests, I write about these conventional vices with the aim to define/understand them better, most of which are the basis of our sufferings. The seven deadly sins, also known as the capital vices or cardinal sins, is a grouping and classification of vices within Christian teachings.

item.title: 'Parasyte' By Hitoshi Iwaaki - Manga Notes
item.description: Parasyte is a manga/anime that deals on some pretty heavy subjects regarding the existence of humans. Thoughts Are humans parasytes? Action Favourite Moments This scene in chapter-48, it was a powerful scene. The arc seems to complete here

item.title: Intention Vs Action - framework to prioritise yourself
item.description: ‚Äã Whenever we are hurt/harmed or have been at the end of an unsatisfying or unfavourable situation, we replay the situation and try to judge each and every action, of ourselves and of others. We often reflect upon the incident from various lenses. There are frameworks to better understand and analyse your/others’ actions, one such framework that has helped me to judge these situations is “Intention Vs Action”. ‚Äã Why Intention Vs Action?

item.title: 'Ghachar Ghochar' By Vivek Shanbhag - Book Notes
item.description: A look into the lives of an Indian household with all its perjudices and beautiful memories. Captures someone who simply sits there for so long must have a thousand wheels spinning in his head. ‚ÄòSir ‚Äì one story, many sides.‚Äô Words after all are nothing by themselves. They burst into meaning only in the minds they‚Äôve entered. At times, I‚Äôm tempted to unburden myself to him. But then, what‚Äôs the point when he seems to know without being told?

item.title: 'Animal Farm' By George Orwell - Book Notes
item.description: The book is a satire on Communism. Fun Facts It was written between 1943 and 1945, and since Britain, US and Soviet Union had good relations, majority publication houses refused to publish the book. Summary Chapter 1: After Mr. Jones, the owner of Manor Farm, falls asleep in a drunken stupor, all of his animals meet in the big barn at the request of old Major, a 12-year-old pig. Major delivers a rousing political speech about the evils inflicted upon them by their human keepers and their need to rebel against the tyranny of Man.

item.title: 'The Count Of Monte Cristo' - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã In 2019, a colleague, with similar appetite as mine, recommended me to read ‘The Count of Monte Cristo’ describing it as the best revenge story there is, and after deliberating on it for some time, I finally took the plunge. The book is not yet complete, but will keep adding my thoughts and notes here. ‚Äã Thoughts on the book Hard vocabulary - The book is from centuries back and people spoke and wrote in a different form.

item.title: 'The Cathedral and The Bazaar' By Eric S. Raymond - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã The Cathedral and the Bazaar (abbreviated CatB) Musings on Linux and Open Source by an Accidental Revolutionary is an essay, and later a book, by Eric S. Raymond ‚Äã Focal points: Every good work of software starts by scratching a developer's personal itch. Too often software developers spend their days grinding away for pay at programs they neither need nor love To solve an interesting problem, start by finding a problem that is interesting to you.

item.title: Introduction to Elm with 2048 game
item.description: ‚Äã In this post I will be creating a small game, 2048 in Elm. 2048 is a game created by gabrielecirulli which went viral in 2014. I chose 2048 because the game mechanics are simple which will help us understand Elm clearly. Also, I didn’t want to make another todo app. You can play here. ‚Äã The Game Mechanics? There are some number tiles on the board (4x4). The number on the tile will be a power of 2 with minimum being 2.

item.title: 'Experimenting with content' by Sattvik Mishra
item.description: ‚Äã Talk: Sattvik Mishra: Experimenting with content Who: ScoopWhoop CEO SOTS: Traditional media houses prioritizes news for you (in a generic way, by giving more space on newspaper and time on tv-shows, also by ordering and grouping same genre together) News is subjective, for some it could be a spoiler in game of thrones, for others it could be sports. To create awareness on unconventional topics, make it relatable. For example: budget to 18yo

item.title: Save the production with Nginx hack
item.description: ‚Äã Quick nginx hack to save your production web server in case the web service starts crashing. If you have been working in a production environment, you know at certain times your web service can crash due to some unknown reason (code failure). It will take some time to do the RCA and fix the issue. A quick hack is to have multiple web services running on different ports resp. that can take the load off if any of them goes down.

item.title: 'The Art of War' By Sun Tzu - Book Notes
item.description: ‚Äã Summary Calculation When you encounter a conflict in your life, before you act, seek out a solitary place that balances and enhances your mind to spiritually think things through. Face the conflict and pro-actively seek to understand what lies at its root. An enemy or adversary is someone who seeks to do you harm. You and your family no doubt have disagreements, but everyone works for the same goals. You don’t want to subdue those you love and care about; you want to support them.

item.title: 'Modern Romance' By Aziz Ansari - Book Notes
item.description: Captures ‚ÄúPeople will go as far as they have to to find a mate, but no farther.‚Äù For the young people who got married in the 1950s, getting married was the first step in adulthood. After high school or college, you got married and you left the house. For today‚Äôs folks, marriage is usually one of the later stages in adulthood. Now most young people spend their twenties and thirties in another stage of life, where they go to university, start a career, and experience being an adult outside of their parents‚Äô home before marriage.

item.title: 'Bhagavad Gita' - Book Notes
item.description: Translation by Winthrop Sargeant Captures happiness and unhappiness are the same, is ready for immortality. if you will not undertake this righteous war, thereupon, having avoided your own duty and glory, you shall incur evil. Holding pleasure and pain to be alike, likewise gain and loss, victory and defeat then engage in battle! Thus you shall not incur evil. be free from those three qualities, Arjuna, indifferent towards the pairs of opposites, eternally fixed in truth, free from thoughts of acquisition and comfort, and possessed of the Self.

‚Äã My name is Sourabh and welcome to my blog. Here, I explore the fascinating worlds of philosophy, psychology, and more. My goal with this blog is to create a space for exploration and learning, both for myself and for others. I’m passionate about learning and growing as an individual, and I believe that engaging with complex ideas and perspectives is a key part of that journey. My approach to these topics is personal, yet I try to be intellectually rigorous.

item.title: Are you joking me?
item.description: ‚Äã With the advent of Internet, the meme culture and standup comedy culture has blasted in the last few years. Internet has not only enabled the reach via social networks, People could try out different material not only cheaply but also with the ease of a click. The showoff of facebook check-ins and instagram stories have acted as catalyst in the expansion of the gig culture. Gags I found funny (likeness is subjective):

item.title: beautiful quotes üôå
item.description: ‚Äã Impatience with actions, patience with results. – Naval ‚Äã Your heart needs to break multiple times for it to open up. – Rumi ‚Äã And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music. – Friedrich Nietzsche ‚Äã Somewhere in the process of maturing into adults, most humans misunderstood comfort for happiness. ‚Äã Alice came to a fork in the road.

item.title: product sketches
item.description: ‚Äã Product Ideas Music Picker Picks or generates a Spotify playlist for you I tell which artists I want to listen and it curates a playlist of best songs by each of them Pick-a-Book This is an idea for a utility application for avid book readers, favoring the mobile platform. Often times in a library when we are searching for a book, we have to scan and go through each and every book’s title or author.

item.title: shower-thoughts ü§î
item.description: ‚Äã* [2022-10-22] * “Save for Later” - Are we becoming collective procastinators? Save this article for later -> Pockets, One-tab, Reddit-save, Twitter-Bookmark, all these apps/features are building procastination in us. How many of us go back to that saved thread or article? ~timeline(NA) Indian traffic behaves how sediments behave in the water, gravitationally pulled towards the signal. Special moments of our lives can be described, but can’t be felt by others.

item.title: travel checklist ‚úàÔ∏è
item.description: ‚Äã Pre-travel checklist Download music on mobile (network unavailablility preparedness) Mobile recharge (talktime, internet), check and confirm availability of network Charge every device (electricity) Make credit card payments Cash in hand ATM cards and pins Necessary printouts (if required) Booking tickets (stay, travelling, if required) Research itineraries (local) Packing ‚Äã Things to carry Hike/Travel: snacks (eatery) snickers dry fruits glucose small bag (quechua) sleeping eye cover neck pillow water bottle hygiene, skincare sunscreen brush and small toothpaste hand soap tissue roll lip balm hand sanitizer small towel gadgets power bank camera headphones clothing/accessories sunglasses/cap medicines crocin (fever/bodyache) loperamide (diarrhoea/loose motions) saradon (headache) ondem (vomiting/motion sickness) levocet (running nose) moov spray (pain relief spray) bandaides ‚Äã

item.title: words ‚úçÔ∏è
item.description: ‚Äã Alone Living alone teaches you the importance of someone’s company ‚Äã Anger memory of pain in the past messenger that shows you that something important to you is being betrayed, squashed, or overlooked. A boundary, a value, a desire. Don’t kill (supress) that messenger (ofcourse don’t react). best remedy is to delay (any reaction) understand the source, when you get irritated, write and explain the feelings, it might help in identifying the source ‚Äã
